description.narrative: The group will work to strengthen the authoritative body and members of the Suyu Sura as they work to defend their principles, values, and identity and recuperate their cultural knowledge, regional leadership, and natural resources from mining and agricultural threats. Currently, mining activities are contaminating the river and lake Uru Uru and Poopo. The pollution of the soil and water has contributed to the large migration out of the communities to urban areas and out of the country. The group will organize the communities impacted by contamination; organize central events to build capacity and inform the communities of the effects of the pollution; develop demands; ally with other communities suffering from contamination; and organize activities around human rights.
